org.domainobject.animation.sp.arrayobject

Interface _IndexedMemoryLazy<T extends ArrayObject>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of array object held in memory
    All Superinterfaces:
    _IndexedMemory<T>, _Memory<T>, java.lang.Iterable<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    IndexedMemoryLazy

    public interface _IndexedMemoryLazy<T extends ArrayObject>
extends _IndexedMemory<T>
    A type of indexed memory that indexes the array objects stored in it only when it is request to burn the array buffer and element array buffer.
    Author:
    Ayco Holleman

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Burn this memory object to OpenGL buffers under the assumption that all array objects contained in it are unique.

    • Method Detail

      • isDestructive

        boolean isDestructive()
        Whether or not the burn process is allowed to delete and move around array objects in the staging area when indexing them (see _Memory for an explanation of what a staging area is). If destructive burning is not allowed, a new array is created with only unique array objects in the proper order (as specified by the index), and that is the array that is burnt to the OpenGL buffer. The staging area remains exactly as it was before burning, duplicates and all. When destructive burning is allowed, no new array is created. Duplicate array objects will be removed from the staging area and the remaining array objects will be packed together again. The staging area is itself burnt to OpenGL.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the burn process is allowed to alter the staging area.
        See Also:
        _Memory.burn()

      • setDestructive

        void setDestructive(boolean b)
        Enable or disable destructive burning.
        Parameters:
        b - true to enable, false to disable.
        See Also:
        isDestructive()

      • pack

        void pack()
        Purge duplicates from the staging area and pack the remaining array objects. Always destructive of course.

      • burnUnique

        ShaderInput burnUnique()
        Burn this memory object to OpenGL buffers under the assumption that all array objects contained in it are unique. No attempt will be made to filter out non-unique array objects.
        Returns:
